c74object.name: el.bvplay~
c74object.digest: el.bvplay~ provides note-statement-like playback of audio from a buffer.
c74object.description: el.bvplay~ is useful mainly because it internally applies an envelope to regions of a buffer during playback.

method.name: list
method.description: Play a note. The values in the list are: [skip, duration, increment, amplitude]. The list 1000 4000 -0.5 1.0 skips 1 second into the buffer, plays for 4 seconds backwards at half speed with unity gain. It is up to the user to ensure that note lists are sensible with respect to the contents of the buffer. For example, don't skip 20 seconds into a buffer that has a duration of 5 seconds. el.bvplay~ is monophonic. Use it in a poly~ if you need polyphony.

method.name: taper
method.description: Set the ramp time for the envelope.

method.name: verbose
method.description: Turn error messaging on or off.
